result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Spencer Lavell Pinkston appeared by video.  Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris appeared by video for Spencer Lavell Pinkston.  Attorney Katherine Seelow in court for State of Wisconsin.
Scheduling conference held. Defense counsel requests an additional scheduling conference. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report - 10-27-2022, filed.
Filed: Original Transcript of Preliminary Hearing ( 19 pages) commencing 09-28-2022 by Katherine Locicero.

Defendant Spencer Lavell Pinkston appeared by video.  Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris appeared by video for Spencer Lavell Pinkston.  Attorney Katherine Seelow appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Kathryn Anderer - MPD Sergeant. State rests. Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 29.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report - 09-28-2022, filed.
Defendant waived time limits for Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Spencer Lavell Pinkston appeared by video.  Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris appeared by video for Spencer Lavell Pinkston.  Attorney Katherine Seelow appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Status Conference. Defense counsel informs court that he has received discovery materials, but is still awaiting an offer from the State. Preliminary hearing adjourned for cause to Br 29.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report - 08-31-2022, filed.
to modify bond, filed.
Received and Filed. Notice of Appearance

Defendant Spencer Lavell Pinkston in court.  Katherine Seelow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
BRANCH 10, JUDGE HAVAS for BRANCH 29 JUDGE KIEFER.
Indigency hearing proceeded.  Court makes a finding that defendant is indigent.  Court appoints Tom Harris as counsel for defendant at the rate of $100.00 per hour.  Attorney Harris notified of appointment by email.  Defendant shall reimburse Milwaukee County at the rate of $100.00 on the 1st of every month upon the completion of the case until paid in full. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.  Status conference scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court is in trial on another matter and unable to hear case. Case is being spun to Judge Havas Br 10. Parties notified and sent to room #504, court house.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report - 08-08-2022

Defendant Spencer Lavell Pinkston in court.  Edward OBrien appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR IN PERSON.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. Defendant is not eligible for SPD appointment of counsel and appears without counsel. Court orders the case adjourned for CAUSE for an Indigency Hearing.  Indigency hearing scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report - 07-18-2022

    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD DUE TO TECHNICAL ISSUES:
Defendant Spencer Lavell Pinkston in court with attorney Jane Jerman.  Defendant Spencer Lavell Pinkston in custody.  Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer Branch 29.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.


  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer Branch 29.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
